RegisterDescription.ToolTip: Camera Configuration File for JAI AD-08xGE

Category.Name: Root
Category.ToolTip: Root Features list

Category.Name: DeviceControl
Category.ToolTip: Category for Device information and control.
Category.Description: Device control features provides general information and control for the device (camera) and its sensor. This is mainly used to identify the device during the enumeration process and to obtain information about the sensor resolution. Other information and controls pertaining to the general state of the device are also included in this category.

Category.Name: ImageFormatControl
Category.ToolTip: Features which control image format and size.
Category.Description: This category contains features which control image format and size.

Category.Name: AcquisitionControl
Category.ToolTip: Acquisition and trigger control features
Category.Description: Category for the acquisition and trigger control features.

Category.Name: JAIAcquisitionControl
Category.ToolTip: JAI Acquisition control features
Category.Description: Category for the JAI acquisition control features.

Category.Name: AnalogControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Analog control features.
Category.Description: This Category contains all the Analog control features.

Category.Name: DigitalProcessing
Category.ToolTip: Digital Processing
Category.Description: Digital Processing

Category.Name: DigitalIOControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the digital input and output control features.
Category.Description: This category contains the digital input and output control features.

Category.Name: PulseGenerators
Category.ToolTip: Pulse Generator Features
Category.Description: This Category contains all features containing Pulse Generators

Category.Name: SequenceControl
Category.ToolTip: This Category contains all features controlling Sequences
Category.Description: This Category contains all features controlling Sequences

Category.Name: TransportLayerControl
Category.ToolTip: Features which are defined by GigE Vision standard.
Category.Description: This category contains features which are defined by GigE Vision standard.

Category.Name: LUTControl
Category.ToolTip: Features which control the Look-up table (LUT).
Category.Description: This category contains features which control the Look-up table (LUT).

Category.Name: ColorTransformationControl
Category.ToolTip: Features which control the Color Transformation.
Category.Description: This category contains contains the Color Transformation control features.

Category.Name: EventControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Event control features.
Category.Description: This category that contains Event control features.

Category.Name: ActionControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Action control features.
Category.Description: Category that contains the Action control features.

Category.Name: UserSetControl
Category.ToolTip: User Set Features
Category.Description: This Category contains all features containing User Sets Control

Category.Name: FactorySettings
Category.ToolTip: Factory Settings
Category.Description: Factory Settings

StringReg.Name: DeviceVendorName
StringReg.ToolTip: Name of the manufacturer of the device.
StringReg.Description: Name of the manufacturer of the device. This is read from the Bootstrap Register

StringReg.Name: DeviceModelName
StringReg.Description: Model of the device. This is read from the Bootstrap Register

StringReg.Name: DeviceVersion
StringReg.Description: Version of the device. This is read from the Bootstrap Register

Integer.Name: DeviceFPGAVersion
Integer.ToolTip: Version of FPGA.
Integer.Description: Version of FPGA.

StringReg.Name: DeviceManufacturerInfo
StringReg.Description: Manufacturer information about the device. This is read from the Bootstrap Register

StringReg.Name: DeviceID
StringReg.Description: Device identifier (serial number). This is read from the Bootstrap Register

StringReg.Name: DeviceUserID
StringReg.Description: This string contains a user-programmable name to assign to the device. It can be used to identify the device.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceScanType
Enumeration.ToolTip: Scan type of the sensor.
Enumeration.Description: Scan type of the sensor.

Integer.Name: DeviceMaxThroughput
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum bandwidth of the data that can be streamed out of the device (Bytes per second).
Integer.Description: Maximum bandwidth of the data that can be streamed out of the device (Bytes per second). This can be used to estimate if the network connection can sustain transfer of free-running images from the camera at its maximum speed.

Enumeration.Name: SensorType
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sensor type of AD-08xGE
Enumeration.Description: Sensor type of AD-08xGE

Command.Name: DeviceReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the device and to put it in its power up state.
Command.Description: Resets the device and to put it in its power up state. This command resets and reboots the camera, after the camera is closed.

Enumeration.Name: PixelFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Pixel Format as specified in GigE Vision standard
Enumeration.Description: Pixel Format as specified in GigE Vision standard

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.ToolTip: Width of the image sensor in pixels
Integer.Description: Width of the image sensor in pixels

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.ToolTip: Height of the image sensor in pixels
Integer.Description: Height of the image sensor in pixels

Enumeration.Name: SensorTaps
Enumeration.ToolTip: Number of taps of the camera sensor
Enumeration.Description: Number of taps of the camera sensor

Enumeration.Name: SensorDigitizationTaps
Enumeration.ToolTip: Number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage
Enumeration.Description: Number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.

Integer.Name: WidthMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum width (in pixels) of the image.
Integer.Description: Maximum width (in pixels) of the image. The dimension is calculated after horizontal binning, decimation or any other function changing the horizontal dimensions of the image.

Integer.Name: HeightMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum height (in pixels) of the image.
Integer.Description: Maximum height (in pixels) of the image. This dimension is calculated after vertical binning, decimation or any other function changing the vertical dimensions of the image.

Integer.Name: ROIMode
Integer.ToolTip: ROI Mode
Integer.Description: The ROI Mode makes it possible to send out up to 5 ROI's (Region of Interest) from the camera cyclically for each trigger. By using this mode, the data stream can be smaller. Each ROI can be overlapped. The ROI Mode is enabled by selecting a value between 2 to 5 and disabled by selecting the value 1. When the ROI Mode is enabled then the camera outputs multiple clipped images cyclically. For instance, by setting the value to 3, the camera outputs the following three images clipped from an original image; first image specified by ROI 1, next the second specified by ROI 2, and the finally specified by ROI 3.

Enumeration.Name: ROISelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: ROI Selector
Enumeration.Description: The ROI Selector selects which ROI will be adjusted using the Width, Height, OffsetX and OffsetY features.

Integer.Name: Width
Integer.ToolTip: Width of the image in pixels
Integer.Description: Width of the image in pixels

Integer.Name: Height
Integer.ToolTip: Height of the image in pixels
Integer.Description: Height of the image in pixels

Integer.Name: OffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: Horizontal offset from the origin to the AOI (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Horizontal offset from the origin to the AOI (in pixels).

Integer.Name: OffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Vertical offset from the origin to the AOI (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Vertical offset from the origin to the AOI (in pixels).

IntSwissKnife.Name: LinePitch
IntSwissKnife.ToolTip: Width of a line in the image data
IntSwissKnife.Description: Width of a line in the image data

Enumeration.Name: SyncMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sync Mode
Enumeration.Description: In sync mode, two sensor outputs can be selected to be either synchronous or asynchronous

Boolean.Name: FastDumpEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Fast Dump (Vertical)
Boolean.Description:
Partial Scan (Vertical).
Selecting "True", the camera works in the fast dump mode. Read-out lines will be as specified in Offset Y and Height.

Integer.Name: BinningVertical
Integer.ToolTip: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together.
Integer.Description: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity (or signal to noise ratio) of the pixels and reduces the vertical resolution (height) of the image. A value of 1 indicates that no vertical binning is performed by the camera.

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.
Enumeration.Description: This feature selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is coming from the sensor.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is coming from the sensor.

Boolean.Name: OBTransferEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Optical Black Transfer Mode.
Boolean.Description: By using the Optical Black Transfer Mode, the user can select whether to include the Optical Black pixels in the image stream. When OB Transfer is enabled the image will include some additional pixels on both side.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode of the device.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the acquisition mode of the device. It defines mainly the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Frames are captured continuously until stopped with the AcquisitionStop command.
EnumEntry.Description: Configures the camera to start an infinite sequence of image acquisition with the AcquisitionStart command that must be stopped explicitly by the application with the AcquisitionStop command.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.ToolTip: Starts the Acquisition of the device.
Command.Description: Starts the Acquisition of the device. The number of frames captured is specified by AcquisitionMode.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.ToolTip: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current Frame.
Command.Description: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current Frame. It is mainly used when AcquisitionMode is Continuous but can be used in any acquisition mode.

Integer.Name: TLParamsLocked
Integer.ToolTip: Implements a flag served by the transport layer indication that it is set up for streaming. Set to 1 when grabbing, 0 when not
Integer.Description: Implements a flag served by the transport layer indication that it is set up for streaming. Set to 1 when grabbing, 0 when not

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of trigger to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of trigger to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger that starts the Acquisition of one or many frames according to AcquisitionMode.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger that starts the Acquisition of one or many frames according to AcquisitionMode.

EnumEntry.Name: TransferStart
EnumEntry.Description: It changes to the Delayed Readout mode.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the selected trigger is active.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the selected trigger is active.

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.Description: Generates an internal trigger. TriggerSource must be set to Software.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the internal signal or physical input Line to use as the trigger source. The selected trigger must have its TriggerMode set to On.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the internal signal or physical input Line to use as the trigger source. The selected trigger must have its TriggerMode set to On.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the activation mode of the trigger.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the activation mode of the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Rising Edge. Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Rising Edge. Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Falling Edge. Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Falling Edge. Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.

Boolean.Name: TriggerSourceInverter
Boolean.ToolTip: The trigger source signal is inverted.
Boolean.Description: The trigger source signal is inverted.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the operation mode of the Exposure (or shutter).
Enumeration.Description: Sets the operation mode of the Exposure (or shutter).

EnumEntry.Name: Timed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Timed exposure. The exposure duration time is set using the ExposureTime or ExposureTimeAuto features and the exposure starts with the FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Timed exposure. The exposure duration time is set using the ExposureTime or ExposureTimeAuto features and the exposure starts with the FrameStart

EnumEntry.Name: TriggerWidth
EnumEntry.ToolTip: TriggerWidth: Uses the width of the current Frame or Line trigger signal(s) pulse to control the exposure duration.
EnumEntry.Description: TriggerWidth: Uses the width of the current Frame or Line trigger signal(s) pulse to control the exposure duration. Note that if the Frame or Line TriggerActivation is RisingEdge or LevelHigh, the exposure duration will be the time the trigger stays High. If TriggerActivation is FallingEdge or LevelLow, the exposure time will last as long as the trigger stays Low.

Enumeration.Name: JAIAcquisitionFrameRate
Enumeration.ToolTip: Acquisition Frame Rate (JAI)
Enumeration.Description: Acquisition Frame Rate (JAI)

EnumEntry.Name: fpsNormal
EnumEntry.Description: Full speed means 30 fps when width and height are set to maximum.

EnumEntry.Name: fps1_2
EnumEntry.Description: Full speed means 30 * 1/2 fps when width and height are set to maximum.

EnumEntry.Name: fps1_4
EnumEntry.Description: Full speed means 30 * 1/4 fps when width and height are set to maximum.

EnumEntry.Name: fps1_8
EnumEntry.Description: Full speed means 30 * 1/8 fps when width and height are set to maximum.

Enumeration.Name: ShutterMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select shutter control mode
Enumeration.Description: Select shutter control mode

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureAutoContinuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exposure duration is constantly adapted by the device to maximize the dynamic range.
EnumEntry.Description: Exposure duration is constantly adapted by the device to maximize the dynamic range.

Integer.Name: JAIExposureTimeRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Exposure Time in Raw format (JAI)
Integer.Description: Exposure Time in Raw format (JAI)

Integer.Name: JAIExposureTimeAbs
Integer.ToolTip: Exposure Time in microseconds (JAI)
Integer.Description: Exposure Time in microseconds (JAI)

Integer.Name: JAIAutoExposureValue
Integer.ToolTip: Auto Exposure Value
Integer.Description: We see the exposure time raw value while Auto Exposure is being performed constantly.

Integer.Name: ExposureTimeRaw
Integer.ToolTip: This feature is used to set the Exposure time in device-specific unit when ExposureMode is Timed.
Integer.Description: This feature is used to set the Exposure time in device-specific unit when ExposureMode is Timed. This controls the duration where the photosensitive cells are exposed to light.

Float.Name: ExposureTimeAbs
Float.ToolTip: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.
Float.Description: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed. This controls the duration where the photosensitive cells are exposed to light.

Float.Name: ExposureTime
Float.ToolTip: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.
Float.Description: This feature is used to set the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed. This controls the duration where the photosensitive cells are exposed to light.

Enumeration.Name: JAIExposureMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Exposure Mode (JAI)
Enumeration.Description: Exposure Mode (JAI)

Enumeration.Name: PredumpMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Pre-dump Mode
Enumeration.Description: The charge of the sensor is dumped while there is no trigger input. It is possible to select it at TriggerMode=On and ExposureMode=Timed.

Boolean.Name: SmearlessEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Smearless Enable
Boolean.Description: Smearless Enable

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features

EnumEntry.Name: AnaloglAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to all pixels
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to all pixels

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalGr
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the Gr pixels
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the Gr pixels

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalGb
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the Gb pixels
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the Gb pixels

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalRed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the red pixels
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the red pixels

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalBlue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the blue pixels
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the blue pixels

Integer.Name: GainRaw
Integer.ToolTip: This feature controls the selected gain as a raw integer value.
Integer.Description: This feature controls the selected gain as a raw integer value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.

Enumeration.Name: GainAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Automatic Gain Control
Enumeration.Description: Automatic Gain Control

Integer.Name: AGCReference
Integer.ToolTip: AGC/Auto-Shutter Reference
Integer.Description: AGC/Auto-Shutter Reference. This value is used as the set-point for both auto exposure functions (both AGC and ASC). The AGC can control the gain between 0dB to +12dB. The ASC can control the exposure time between 1/250 second to Shutter-off.

Integer.Name: AutoGainValue
Integer.ToolTip: Auto Gain Value
Integer.Description: We see the Gain Raw value while AGC is being performed constantly.

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Black Level will be applied to all pixels
EnumEntry.Description: Black Level will be applied to all pixels

Integer.Name: BlackLevelRaw
Integer.ToolTip: This feature controls the digital black setup level as a raw integer value.
Integer.Description: This feature controls the digital black setup level as a raw integer value. This represents a DC offset applied to the video signal.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceWhiteAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Perform automatic white balancing
Enumeration.Description: Perform automatic white balancing

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is automatically adjusted once by the device.

Enumeration.Name: StatusOfProcessing
Enumeration.ToolTip: This indicates the status of the processing performed inside the camera.
Enumeration.Description: This indicates the status of the processing performed inside the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Completed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Not busy, or processing has been finished successfully.
EnumEntry.Description: Not busy, or processing has been finished successfully.

EnumEntry.Name: HighVideoSignal
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Too high level of the video signal to have completed the processing.
EnumEntry.Description: Too high level of the video signal to have completed the processing.
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Too high level of the video signal

EnumEntry.Name: LowVideoSignal
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Too low level of the video signal to have completed the processing.
EnumEntry.Description: Too low level of the video signal to have completed the processing.
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Too low level of the video signal

EnumEntry.Name: TimeOutError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Time-out error prevented the processing from being completed.
EnumEntry.Description: Time-out error prevented the processing from being completed.

EnumEntry.Name: ReachingLimitValue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Reaching a limit of a feature's value prevented the processing from being completed.
EnumEntry.Description: Reaching a limit of a feature's value prevented the processing from being completed.
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Reaching a limit of a feature's value

EnumEntry.Name: InappropriateTriggerMode
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Inappropriate trigger mode prevented the processing from being initiated.
EnumEntry.Description: Inappropriate trigger mode prevented the processing from being initiated.

Enumeration.Name: AWBAreaSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: AWB Area Selector
Enumeration.Description: AWB Area Selector

Boolean.Name: AWBAreaEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: AWB Area Enable
Boolean.Description: AWB Area Enable

Integer.Name: AWBAreaEnableAll
Integer.ToolTip: AWB Area Enable All
Integer.Description: AWB Area Enable All

Enumeration.Name: IrisSignalOutputMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Iris Signal Output Mode
Enumeration.Description: Choose the camera of the Iris signal to output.

Enumeration.Name: GammaSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Gamma Selector
Enumeration.Description: Gamma Selector

Enumeration.Name: GammaSet
Enumeration.ToolTip: Gamma Set
Enumeration.Description: Gamma Set

Boolean.Name: ShadingCorrectionEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Shading Correction Enable
Boolean.Description: Shading Correction Enable

Enumeration.Name: ShadingCorrectionMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Shading Correction Mode
Enumeration.Description: Shading Correction Mode

Enumeration.Name: ShadingDataSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Shading Data Selector
Enumeration.Description: Shading Data Selector

Integer.Name: ShadingDataIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Shading Data Index
Integer.Description: Shading Data Index

Integer.Name: ShadingDataValue
Integer.ToolTip: Shading Data Value
Integer.Description: Shading Data Value

Enumeration.Name: BlemishReductionEnable
Enumeration.ToolTip: Blemish Reduction Enable
Enumeration.Description: Blemish Reduction Enable

EnumEntry.Name: BothBlemishReductionEnable
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Both of Black and White Blemish Reduction Enable

Enumeration.Name: BlemishDataSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Blemish Data Selector
Enumeration.Description: Blemish Data Selector

Integer.Name: BlemishDataIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Blemish Data Index
Integer.Description: Blemish Data Index

Integer.Name: BlemishDataValue
Integer.ToolTip: Blemish Data Value
Integer.Description: Blemish Data Value

Boolean.Name: KneeEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Knee Enable
Boolean.Description: Knee Enable

Enumeration.Name: KneeSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Knee Selector
Enumeration.Description: Knee Selector

Integer.Name: KneeSlope
Integer.ToolTip: Knee Slope
Integer.Description: Knee Slope

Integer.Name: KneePoint
Integer.ToolTip: Knee Point
Integer.Description: Knee Point

Enumeration.Name: LineSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the physical line (or pin) of the external device connector to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the physical line (or pin) of the external device connector to configure. When a Line is selected, all the other Line features will be applied to its associated I/O control block and will condition the resulting input or output signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Line1 is assigned to TTL Out
EnumEntry.Description: Line1 is assigned to TTL Out

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Lin32 is assigned to Optical Out 1
EnumEntry.Description: Line3 is assigned to Optical Out 1

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Line4 is assigned to Optical Out 2
EnumEntry.Description: Line4 is assigned to Optical Out 2

Enumeration.Name: LineSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which internal acquisition or I/O source signal to output on the selected Line.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which internal acquisition or I/O source signal to output on the selected Line. LineMode must be Output.

Boolean.Name: LineStatus
Boolean.ToolTip: Line Status
Boolean.Description: This reads the current status of the selected input or output Line.

Integer.Name: LineStatusAll
Integer.ToolTip: Line Status All
Integer.Description: Returns the current status of all available Line signals at time of polling in a single bitfield.

Boolean.Name: LineInverter
Boolean.ToolTip: Controls if the signal line is inverted. False means "Active High" and True for "Active Low".
Boolean.Description: Controls if the signal line is inverted. False means "Active High" and True for "Active Low".

Enumeration.Name: LineMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the physical Line is used to Input or Output a signal.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the physical Line is used to Input or Output a signal.

Enumeration.Name: LineFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output Line.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output Line.

Enumeration.Name: UserOutputSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects User Output, which was called "Software Trigger" before.
Enumeration.Description: Selects User Output, which was called "Software Trigger" before.

Boolean.Name: UserOutputValue
Boolean.ToolTip: Sets the value of the selected User Output, which was called "Software Trigger" before.
Boolean.Description: Sets the value of the selected User Output, which was called "Software Trigger" before.

Integer.Name: UserOutputValueAll
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the value of all the bits of the User Output register.
Integer.Description: Sets the value of all the bits of the User Output register.

Integer.Name: SoftwareTrigger0
Integer.ToolTip: Software Trigger 0
Integer.Description: Software Trigger 0, which should be renamed "User Output 0" to conform to the GenICam SFNC.

Integer.Name: SoftwareTrigger1
Integer.ToolTip: Software Trigger 1
Integer.Description: Software Trigger 1, which should be renamed "User Output 1" to conform to the GenICam SFNC.

Integer.Name: SoftwareTrigger2
Integer.ToolTip: Software Trigger 2
Integer.Description: Software Trigger 2, which should be renamed "User Output 2" to conform to the GenICam SFNC.

Integer.Name: SoftwareTrigger3
Integer.ToolTip: Software Trigger 3
Integer.Description: Software Trigger 3, which should be renamed "User Output 3" to conform to the GenICam SFNC.

Integer.Name: ClockPreScaler
Integer.ToolTip: Clock Pre-scaler for the Pulse Generators
Integer.Description: Clock Pre-scaler for the Pulse Generators

Float.Name: PulseGeneratorClock
Float.Description: Pulse Generator Clock (MHz). This value is calculated based on the clock source and the pre scaler.

Enumeration.Name: PulseGeneratorSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Pulse Generator Selector
Enumeration.Description: Pulse Generator Selector

Enumeration.Name: PulseGeneratorClearSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the source to clear the Pulse Generator.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the source to clear the Pulse Generator.

Boolean.Name: PulseGeneratorClearInverter
Boolean.ToolTip: Controls if the pulse generator signal is inverted. False means "Active High" and True for "Active Low".
Boolean.Description: Controls if the pulse generator signal is inverted. False means "Active High" and True for "Active Low".

Integer.Name: PulseGeneratorLength
Integer.ToolTip: Pulse Generator Length in Pulse Generator Clock ticks.
Integer.Description: Pulse Generator Length in Pulse Generator Clock ticks. This is the total length of the pulse for every time it is repeated.

Float.Name: PulseGeneratorLengthMs
Float.Description: Pulse Generator Length in milliseconds. This is the total length of the pulse for every time it is repeated.

Integer.Name: PulseGeneratorStartPoint
Integer.ToolTip: Pulse Generator Start Point in Pulse Generator Clock ticks.
Integer.Description: Pulse Generator Start Point in Pulse Generator Clock ticks. This specifies the starting point (rising edge) of the pulse within the total pulse length.

Float.Name: PulseGeneratorStartPointMs
Float.ToolTip: Pulse Generator Start Point in milliseconds.
Float.Description: Pulse Generator Start Point in milliseconds. This specifies the starting point (rising edge) of the pulse within the total pulse length.

Integer.Name: PulseGeneratorEndPoint
Integer.ToolTip: Pulse Generator End Point in Pulse Generator Clock ticks.
Integer.Description: Pulse Generator End Point in Pulse Generator Clock ticks. This specifies the end point (falling edge) of the pulse within the total pulse length.

Float.Name: PulseGeneratorEndPointMs
Float.ToolTip: Pulse Generator End Point in milliseconds.
Float.Description: Pulse Generator End Point in milliseconds. This specifies the end point (falling edge) of the pulse within the total pulse length.

SwissKnife.Name: PulseGeneratorPulseWidthMs
SwissKnife.Description: Pulse Generator pulse-width in milliseconds. It is calculated as the time in milliseconds between the start point (rising edge) and the end point (falling edge) of the pulse.

Integer.Name: PulseGeneratorRepeatCount
Integer.ToolTip: Pulse Generator Repeat Count
Integer.Description: Pulse Generator Repeat Count. 0 is Infinite

Enumeration.Name: PulseGeneratorClearActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the activation mode of the input to clear the Pulse Generator.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the activation mode of the input to clear the Pulse Generator.

Enumeration.Name: SequenceMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sequence Mode
Enumeration.Description: GainRaw, ExposureTimeRaw, and ROI is switched at each trigger input. It is possible to select it at TriggerMode=ON and ExposureMode=Timed.

Integer.Name: SequenceRepetitions
Integer.ToolTip: Number of repetitions of the sequence
Integer.Description: Number of repetitions of the sequence

Integer.Name: SequenceEndingPosition
Integer.ToolTip: Last Sequence to perform
Integer.Description: Last Sequence to perform

Enumeration.Name: SequenceSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sequence Selector
Enumeration.Description: Sequence Selector

Integer.Name: SequenceRepeatCountInEachStep
Integer.ToolTip: Repeat count in the each sequence step
Integer.Description: Repeat count in the each sequence step

Integer.Name: SequenceExposureTimeRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sequence Exposure Time in Raw format
Integer.Description: Sequence Exposure Time in Raw format

Integer.Name: SequenceMasterGain
Integer.ToolTip: Sequence Master Gain in Raw format
Integer.Description: Sequence Master Gain in Raw format

Integer.Name: SequenceROISizeX
Integer.ToolTip: Sequence ROI Size X
Integer.Description: Sequence ROI Size X

Integer.Name: SequenceROISizeY
Integer.ToolTip: Sequence ROI Size Y
Integer.Description: Sequence ROI Size Y

Integer.Name: SequenceROIOffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: Sequence ROI Offset X
Integer.Description: Sequence ROI Offset X

Integer.Name: SequenceROIOffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Sequence ROI Offset Y
Integer.Description: Sequence ROI Offset Y

Command.Name: SequenceResetCommand
Command.ToolTip: Reset Sequence Settings in user area.
Command.Description: Reset Sequence Settings in user area.

Integer.Name: PayloadSize
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel.
Integer.Description: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel. This includes any end-of-line, end-of-frame statistics or other stamp data. This is the total size of data payload for a data block.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMajor
Integer.ToolTip: Major version of the GigE Vision specification supported by this device
Integer.Description: This field represents the major version of the GigE Vision specification supported by this device. 1.0 for the first release of GigE Vision.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMinor
Integer.ToolTip: Minor version of the GigE Vision specification supported by this device
Integer.Description: This field represents the minor version of the GigE Vision specification supported by this device. 1.0 for the first release of GigE Vision.

Boolean.Name: GevDeviceModeIsBigEndian
Boolean.ToolTip: This represents the endianess of bootstrap registers.
Boolean.Description: Endianess might be used to interpret multi-byte data for READMEM and WRITEMEM commands. This represents the endianess of bootstrap registers.

Enumeration.Name: GevDeviceModeCharacterSet
Enumeration.ToolTip: This register represents the character set.
Enumeration.Description: This register represents the character set.

Integer.Name: GevInterfaceSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects which physical network interface to control.
Integer.Description: Selects which physical network interface to control.

Integer.Name: GevMACAddress
Integer.ToolTip: MAC Address of the device
Integer.Description: MAC Address of the device

Enumeration.Name: GevSupportedOptionSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOption
Boolean.ToolTip: Returns if the selected GEV option is supported.
Boolean.Description: Returns if the selected GEV option is supported.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationLLA
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicate if LLA is supported by the device
Boolean.Description: Indicate if LLA is supported by the device

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationDHCP
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicate if DHCP is supported by the device
Boolean.Description: Indicate if DHCP is supported by the device

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicate if Persistent IP is supported by the device
Boolean.Description: Indicate if Persistent IP is supported by the device

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationLLA
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicate if LLA is activated as a currently used IP configuration scheme.
Boolean.Description: Indicate if LLA is activated as a currently used IP configuration scheme.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationDHCP
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicate if DHCP is activated as a currently used IP configuration scheme.
Boolean.Description: Indicate if DHCP is activated as a currently used IP configuration scheme.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicate if persistent IP is activated as a currently used IP configuration scheme.
Boolean.Description: Indicate if persistent IP is activated as a currently used IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevCurrentIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Current IP Address
Integer.Description: Current IP Address

Integer.Name: GevCurrentSubnetMask
Integer.ToolTip: Current Subnet Mask
Integer.Description: Current Subnet Mask

Integer.Name: GevCurrentDefaultGateway
Integer.ToolTip: Current Default Gateway
Integer.Description: Current Default Gateway

StringReg.Name: GevFirstURL
StringReg.ToolTip: First choice of URL for XML device description file
StringReg.Description: This feature stores the first URL to the XML device description file. The First URL is used as the first choice by the application to retrieve the XML device description file.

StringReg.Name: GevSecondURL
StringReg.ToolTip: Second choice of URL for XML device description file
StringReg.Description: This feature stores the second URL to the XML device description file. This URL is an alternative if the application was unsuccessful to retrieve the device description file using the first URL.

Integer.Name: GevNumberOfInterfaces
Integer.ToolTip: This feature indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.
Integer.Description: This feature indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the Persistent IP address for this network interface.
Integer.Description: Indicates the Persistent IP address for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentSubnetMask
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface.
Integer.Description: Indicates the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentDefaultGateway
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the persistent default gateway for this network interface.
Integer.Description: Indicates the persistent default gateway for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevMessageChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOptionalCommandsEVENTDATA
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if EVENTDATA_CMD and EVENTDATA_ACK are supported.
Boolean.Description: Indicates if EVENTDATA_CMD and EVENTDATA_ACK are supported.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOptionalCommandsEVENT
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if EVENT_CMD and EVENT_ACK are supported.
Boolean.Description: Indicates if EVENT_CMD and EVENT_ACK are supported.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOptionalCommandsPACKETRESEND
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if PACKETRESEND_CMD is supported.
Boolean.Description: Indicates if PACKETRESEND_CMD is supported.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOptionalCommandsWRITEMEM
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if WRITEMEM_CMD and WRITEMEM_ACK are supported.
Boolean.Description: Indicates if WRITEMEM_CMD and WRITEMEM_ACK are supported.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOptionalCommandsConcatenation
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if multiple operations in a single message are supported.
Boolean.Description: Indicates if multiple operations in a single message are supported.

Integer.Name: GevHeartbeatTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the current heartbeat timeout in milliseconds.
Integer.Description: Indicates the current heartbeat timeout in milliseconds.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampTickFrequency
Integer.ToolTip: 64-bit value indicating the number of timestamp clock tick in 1 second.
Integer.Description: 64-bit value indicating the number of timestamp clock tick in 1 second. Timestamp tick frequency is 0 if timestamp is not supported.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlLatch
Command.ToolTip: Latches the current timestamp value of the device.
Command.Description: Latches the current timestamp value of the device.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the timestamp count of the device.
Command.Description: Resets the timestamp count of the device.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValue
Integer.ToolTip: Latched value of the timestamp.
Integer.Description: Latched value of the timestamp. Value must first be latched using GevTimestampControlLatch.

Enumeration.Name: GevCCP
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the device access privilege of an application.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application. Only one application is allowed to control the device. This application is able to write into device registers. Other applications can read device register only if the controlling application does not have the exclusive privilege.

Integer.Name: GevMCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: The port to which the device must send messages.
Integer.Description: The port to which the device must send messages. Setting this value to 0 closes the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCDA
Integer.ToolTip: Message channel destination IPv4 address.
Integer.Description: Message channel destination IPv4 address. The destination address can be a multicast or a unicast address.

Integer.Name: GevMCTT
Integer.ToolTip: Message Channel Transmission Timeout in milliseconds.
Integer.Description: Message Channel Transmission Timeout in milliseconds.

Integer.Name: GevMCRC
Integer.ToolTip: Number of retransmissions allowed on the message channel.
Integer.Description: Number of retransmissions allowed on the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCSP
Integer.ToolTip: Source port number of message channel.
Integer.Description: Source port number of message channel.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the stream channel to control.
Integer.Description: Selects the stream channel to control.

Integer.Name: GevSCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: The port to which the device must send data stream.
Integer.Description: The port to which the device must send data stream. Setting this value to 0 closes the stream channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSDoNotFragment
Boolean.ToolTip: Do Not Fragment
Boolean.Description: This bit is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet. It can be used by the application to prevent IP fragmentation of packets on the stream channel.

Integer.Name: GevSCPSPacketSize
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the stream packet size in bytes to send on this channel.
Integer.Description: Specifies the stream packet size in bytes to send on this channel. This does not include data leader and data trailer and the last data packet which might be of smaller size (since packet size is not necessarily a multiple of block size for stream channel). If a device cannot support the requested packet size, then it must not fire a test packet when requested to do so.

Integer.Name: GevSCPD
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel.
Integer.Description: Indicates the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel. This can be used as a crude flow-control mechanism if the application or the network infrastructure cannot keep up with the packets coming from the device.

Integer.Name: GevSCDA
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the stream channel destination IPv4 address for the selected stream channel.
Integer.Description: This value sets the stream channel destination IPv4 address for the selected stream channel. The destination can be a unicast or a multicast.

Integer.Name: GevSCSP
Integer.ToolTip: Source port number of stream channel.
Integer.Description: Source port number of stream channel.

IntSwissKnife.Name: PacketPayload
IntSwissKnife.ToolTip: This is the amount of payload data that is sent in each GVSP image packet.
IntSwissKnife.Description: This is the amount of payload data that is sent in each GVSP image packet.

IntSwissKnife.Name: NumberOfPacketsPerImage
IntSwissKnife.ToolTip: Number of individual packets per image.
IntSwissKnife.Description: Intermediate value. This value is calculated based on the Payload Size and the Packet Size. This is the number of individual packets each image will be broken into when it is sent over the Stream channel

IntSwissKnife.Name: TotalImageSizeOnNetwork
IntSwissKnife.ToolTip: Total number of bytes sent per image including GVSP overhead.
IntSwissKnife.Description: Total number of bytes sent per image including GVSP overhead.

SwissKnife.Name: TotalImageTransmissionTimePerSecond
SwissKnife.ToolTip: Total Image Transmission Time per second
SwissKnife.Description: Total amount of time it takes to send the image data per second at the specified frame-rate
SwissKnife.DisplayName: Total Image Transmission Time per second (s)

SwissKnife.Name: TotalPauseTimePerSecond
SwissKnife.ToolTip: Total pause time to be added to the image data transmission per second
SwissKnife.Description: Total pause time to be added to the image data transmission per second

SwissKnife.Name: InterPacketDelayTime
SwissKnife.Description: Inter-Packet Delay time (in seconds) to be added between each GVSP image packet in order to achieve the specified maximum frame-rate

SwissKnife.Name: InterPacketDelayEstimate
SwissKnife.ToolTip: Estimate for the Inter-Packet Delay value to be used with this camera
SwissKnife.Description: This is an estimate of the Inter-Packet Delay value to be used with this camera. This value has to be thought of as a starting point for finding the optimal Inter-Packet Delay value for the camera when it is used in a multi-camera system. The calculation is based on the assumption that if the stream channel communication is spread over time as much as possible using the Inter-Packet Delay - but only so much that the maximum specified frame rate still can be achieved, then the camera will have the minimal impact on the communication from the other cameras connected on the same Gigabit Ethernet network. A little overhead should always be reserved for retransmissions for the image stream so it is not adviced to use 100% as the Expected Bandwidth usage. A typical value would be around 90-95%

Float.Name: ExpectedBandwidthUsage
Float.ToolTip: Expected bandwidth usage in percent of a 1 Gbit/s connection
Float.Description: Expected bandwidth usage in percent of a 1 Gbit/s connection

Float.Name: MaxAcquisitionFrameRate
Float.ToolTip: Expected maximum number of images sent per second.
Float.Description: Expected maximum number of images sent per second. This will typically be the frame-rate when the camera is running continuous

Boolean.Name: LUTEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the LUT
Boolean.Description: Enables the LUT

Enumeration.Name: LUTSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature selects which LUT is controlled by the various LUT features.
Enumeration.Description: This feature selects which LUT is controlled by the various LUT features.

Integer.Name: LUTIndex
Integer.ToolTip: This feature provides the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.
Integer.Description: This feature provides the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LUTValue
Integer.ToolTip: This feature represents the Value found at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.
Integer.Description: This feature represents the Value found at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.

Register.Name: LUTValueAll
Register.ToolTip: Accesses the entire content of the selected LUT in one chunk access

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Category that contains the Color Transformation control features.
Enumeration.Description: This feature contains the Color Transformation control.

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationValueSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the Gain factor of the Transformation matrix to access in the selected Color Transformation module.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the Gain factor of the Transformation matrix to access in the selected Color Transformation module.

Float.Name: ColorTransformationValue
Float.ToolTip: Represents the value of the selected Gain factor inside the Transformation matrix.
Float.Description: Represents the value of the selected Gain factor inside the Transformation matrix.

Enumeration.Name: EventSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature is used to select which internal Event to signal to the host application.
Enumeration.Description: This feature is used to select which internal Event to signal to the host application.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionTrigger
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just received a trigger for the acquisition of an image.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just received a trigger for the acquisition of an image.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the Acquisition of one or many Frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the Acquisition of one or many Frames.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the Acquisition of one or many Frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the Acquisition of one or many Frames.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just started the exposure of one frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just started the exposure of one frame.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device just completed the exposure of one frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Device just completed the exposure of one frame.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyLineAnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The event will be generated when the rising or falling edge is detected on any lines.
EnumEntry.Description: The event will be generated when the rising or falling edge is detected on any lines.

Enumeration.Name: EventNotification
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature is used to select which type of notification is sent to the host application for the selected event.
Enumeration.Description: This feature is used to select which type of notification is sent to the host application for the selected event.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is disabled.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected Event notification is enabled.
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Event notification is enabled.

EnumEntry.Name: GigEVisionEvent
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sends a standard GigE Vision event notification.
EnumEntry.Description: Sends a standard GigE Vision event notification.

Category.Name: EventAcquisitionTriggerData
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Acquisition Trigger Event Data features.
Category.Description: This category that contains Acquisition Trigger Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionTrigger
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the AcquisitionTrigger type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the AcquisitionTrigger type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionTriggerFrameID
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the AcquisitionTrigger Event.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the AcquisitionTrigger Event.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionTriggerTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the AcquisitionTrigger Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the AcquisitionTrigger Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.

Category.Name: EventExposureStartData
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Exposure Start Event Data features.
Category.Description: Category that contains Exposure Start Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventExposureStart
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the ExposureStart type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the ExposureStart type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Integer.Name: EventExposureStartFrameID
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the ExposureStart Event.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the ExposureStart Event.

Integer.Name: EventExposureStartTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the ExposureStart Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the ExposureStart Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.

Category.Name: EventExposureEndData
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Exposure End Event Data features.
Category.Description: Category that contains Exposure End Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventExposureEnd
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the ExposureEnd type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the ExposureEnd type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Integer.Name: EventExposureEndFrameID
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the ExposureEnd Event.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique Identifier of the Frame (or image) that generated the ExposureEnd Event.

Integer.Name: EventExposureEndTimestamp
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the ExposureEnd Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the ExposureEnd Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Acquisition Start Event Data features.
Category.Description: Category that contains Acquisition Start Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionStart
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the AcquisitionStart type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the AcquisitionStart type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the AcquisitionStart Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Acquisition End Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventAcquisitionEnd
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the AcquisitionEnd type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the AcquisitionEnd type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Timestamp of the AcquisitionEnd Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.
Integer.Description: Returns the Timestamp of the AcquisitionEnd Event. It can be used to determine precisely when the event occured.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Any Line Any Edge Event Data features.
Category.Description: Category that contains Any Line Any Edge Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventAnyLineAnyEdge
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the AnyLineAnyEdge type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the AnyLineAnyEdge type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains UpdatedAllFeatures Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventUpdatedAllFeatures
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the UpdatedAllFeatures type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the UpdatedAllFeatures type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains ProcessingDone Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventProcessingDone
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the ProcessingDone type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the ProcessingDone type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains VideoParamsChanged Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventVideoParamsChanged
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the VideoParamsChanged type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.
Integer.Description: Returns the unique identifier of the VideoParamsChanged type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Category.Name: EventOppChParamsChangedData
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains Opposit Channel Parameters Changed Event Data features.

Integer.Name: EventOppChParamsChanged
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the unique identifier of the Opposit Channel Parameters Changed type of Event. This feature can be used to register a callback function to be notified of the event occurrence. Its value uniquely identifies the type of event that will be received.

Integer.Name: ActionDeviceKey
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands.
Integer.Description: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands. The device internal assertion of an action signal is only authorized if the ActionDeviceKey and the action device key value in the protocol message are equal.

Integer.Name: ActionSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects to which Action Signal further Action settings apply.
Integer.Description: Selects to which Action Signal further Action settings apply.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupKey
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the key that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
Integer.Description: Provides the key that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupMask
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the mask that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
Integer.Description: Provides the mask that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.
Command.Description: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.ToolTip: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the device.
Command.Description: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the device.

Category.Name: FFactorySettingsInShipping
Category.ToolTip: Factory Settings in Shipping
Category.Description: Features which need to be set for each camera in shipping in JAIM.

EnumEntry.Name: FJAISpecialMode
EnumEntry.DisplayName: JAI Special Mode (Allows multiple application access)
